articles.title: Reporting on Epidemic Under China's Watchful Eye...
articles.description: Reporting on Epidemic Under China's Watchful Eye... (Second column, 3rd story, link ) Related stories: Coronavirus-themed party stirs anger at college! Thousands of Americans in voluntary quarantine... Confusion mounts over counting methods... Another hotspot…
articles.content:
This article is based on the experiences of Wall Street Journal reporters Stephanie Yang, Shan Li and James T. Areddy, as recounted by Ms. Yang. 
Arriving at a hotel on Jan. 26 in a city about 200 miles from Wuhan, our plan was set. My colleague Shan Li and … [+157 chars]

articles.author: Paul Hannon, Amara Omeokwe
articles.title: Coronavirus Hits US Business Activity - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Surveys indicate February U.S. output fell to lowest level in more than six years as global economies started to feel effects of China’s virus outbreak
articles.content:
U.S. business activity in February fell to its lowest level in more than six years as companies pulled back on fears that Chinas coronavirus outbreak would slow global growth, according to private survey data released Friday.
Data firm IHS Markit said its U.… [+276 chars]

articles.author: Jing Yang
articles.title: Why Many Businesses Will Be on the Hook for Coronavirus Losses - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Burned by SARS, insurers across the board now exclude epidemics in standard business-interruption policies
articles.content:
The coronavirus is proving costly for global businessand insurance wont be much help.
With large parts of China in lockdown and other Asian countries on high alert, the virus, which causes an acute respiratory disease called Covid-19, has disrupted shops, ho… [+135 chars]

articles.author: Akane Otani
articles.title: Tech and Utilities Stocks Both Rally in Polarized Market - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Two best-performing sectors in S&P 500 in 2020 typically move in opposite directions
articles.content:
Risky investments have rallied this year. So have safe ones.
The tug of war across financial markets shows just how divided the outlook among investors is as they struggle to assess the economic toll of the growing coronavirus epidemic.
Within the stock mar… [+86 chars]

articles.author: Matt Wirz
articles.title: U.S. Long-Bond Yield Hits All-Time Low - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: U.S. Long-Bond Yield Hits All-Time Low The Wall Street Journal Here’s three reasons why the 30-year Treasury yield plunged to a record low MarketWatch Stock market news live: Stocks fall, Treasury yields slump amid ongoing coronavirus fears Yahoo Finance US s…
articles.content:
U.S. Treasury yields fell sharply Friday as a flight to safety drove global investors into the government securities.
The intraday yield of the benchmark 30-year bond fell to a record of 1.889%, well below the previous all-time low of 1.905% in late August, … [+132 chars]

articles.description: Emerging-market companies sold a record amount of foreign-currency debt this year; energy companies amassed a looming debt burden, and garlic prices have risen because of the coronavirus-related supply chain disruptions.
